articles.author: Jonathan Lambert
articles.title: Babies take a lesson from soldiers in the war against malaria - NPR
articles.description: Inspired by a military strategy to ward off disease-carrying mosquitoes, researchers see if the technique will help cut malaria infections in little ones.
articles.content:
Babies may soon join soldiers in the fight to ward off malaria.
For years, the U.S. military has treated uniforms with insecticide to repel mosquitoes and the malaria they can transmit. Ross Boyce

articles.author: Reece Rogers, Boone Ashworth
articles.title: Jony Ive Says He Wants His OpenAI Devices to ‘Make Us Happy’ - WIRED
articles.description: “I don’t think we have an easy relationship with our technology at the moment,” the former Apple designer said at OpenAI's developer conference in San Francisco on Monday.
articles.content:
At OpenAIs developer conference in San Francisco on Monday, CEO Sam Altman and ex-Apple designer Jony Ive spoke in vague terms about the family of devices the pair are currently working to develop.
